metadata.title: CVE-2018-12551 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When Eclipse Mosquitto version 1.0 to 1.5.5 (inclusive) is configured touse a password file for authentication, any malformed data in the passwordfile will be treated as valid. This typically means that the malformed databecomes a username and no password. If this occurs, clients can circumventauthentication and get access to the broker by using the malformedusername. In particular, a blank line will be treated as a valid emptyusername. Other security measures are unaffected. Users who have only usedthe mosquitto_passwd utility to create and modify their password files areunaffected by this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmosquitto1 - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmosquittopp1 - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
mosquitto - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
mosquitto-clients - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mosquitto package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1').
